Reviews.Title: “My stay was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: jkeys68
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a 2bd room villa for 3 nights on 3/13/12. The iving room was huge, witha nice LCD TV and dvd player and the master bedroom very spacious. I was quite surprised that it was so large and included a screened lanai. The living room was large enough for three people to play Kinect comfortably. The master bedroom, while spacious with a LCD TV, had a huge rainfall walk-in shower but I was somewhat disappointed that it had no jetted tub. The 2nd bd had a full and twin bed and althought not as large as the master, had its own bathroom and LCD TV. The beds were very comfortable and the full kitchen was stocked with anything that you'd need to cook. The villas themselves were in the back of the Marriott Trade Center which seemed odd for you could see all of the trucks unloading and loading and you drove in. But it had plenty to do with the its own pool, two jacuzzis, tennis and basketball courts, kids playground, bbq grills, shuffleboard, chessboard, game room and play area in the lobby. The pool, althought somewhat small and no bar, was very quiet each time we used it. I believe most people walk to the World Trade Center pool which was huge and only a very short walk from the villas. It is the largest free form pool in Orlando and had a restaurant, bar, waterfalls, kiddle play area and pool and a slide. We spent a day there and really enjoyed it. The only downside to the villas was that the free wireless internet didn't work the entire time we were there which wasn't good being that I needed to get some work done. Overall, it was a very enjoyable stay, close to the theme parks, very clean, staff was very friendly and I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sabal Palm for quiet Orlando getaway”
Reviews.Author: bazinga55
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Marriott Sabal Palms and found the villa to be spacious, newly decorated and clean. The have smking and non-smoking building so if this is an issue for you make that request when you make your reservation. The bedding is Marriott comfy but the two beds in the second bedroom are firm, comes with a sleeper sofa so can sleep up to 7 comfortably. Nice kitchen. Has screened patio which is nice to sit and relax. On a golf course so patio view a lovely. Grounds are well maintained. Updated work out facility on premises and nice pool with amle seeting. Sometimes you stay at a place and you can't find a seat by the pool, not the case here. Could use some walking paths. Early a.m. you can walk the golf course path, easy access to the Marriott World Center for restaurants, bars, golf, tennis, pools etc. A Shuttle is available to and from for your convenience and even if you have a car, I would walk or take the shuttle, as there is a charge for parking at the World Center.

Reviews.Title: “Florida Trip 2012”
Reviews.Author: tmnh6179_12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sabal Palms in late February and really enjoyed the stay. Like other reviews for this property, its proximity to Disney World is great (5 to 10 minute drive). The ability to use all the amenities on the property was really nice too (great fitness facilities). During our stay, my wife had to have a next-day air package shipped to us and the staff was very helpful to make sure we received the package. We plan to go back to Orlando next February (my wife likes to run in the Disney Princess Half Marathon) and hope to stay at the Sabal Palms again.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong staying at this place”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodBlonde
Reviews.Content: Once again had an amazing experience staying at this place. Stayed for two weeks and loved every minute of it. The place had lots of room and was very clean. It is at the back of the Marriott complex and is difficult to find the first time but is worth it. Very quiet and peaceful. Every morning we had turtles and a croc visiting us and we would feed them hot dogs. The pool area was always quiet and it felt like we had the place to ourselves. Would definetly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Sable Palms - One of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: thecappuccinoman
Reviews.Content: When planning an extended stay in the Walt Disney World area Marriotts Sable Palms property is definately one to consider. This newly renovated property is within 2 miles from the Disney entrance and close to shopping, attractions and most all highways. We are staying in a 2 bedroom villa which we find spacious, elegant, excellent floor plan and one of the most desirable properties we have stayed in. The decor is beautifully put together. The staff has been excellent! This resort has an excellent workout center, tennis/basketball courts, swimming pool, sauna, jacuzzi and adjacent golf course all of which are maintain beautifully. If this isn't enough you can take an easy 5 min walk to the main property of World Marriott where you will find around 8-10 other pools, shopping, restaurants, bars, spa and bars, which can be accessed and used by Sable Palms occupants. I have stayed in many timeshare properties over the years and this is absolutely one of the best! It reminds me of an upscale property that you might find in the carribbean or Mexico with its' huge swimming pool with waterfalls and bars located poolside and above the falls overlooking the pool. The variety of the shops, restaurants, bars, spa facilities, activities from childrens, adults or family makes this a great find. Although we planned on attending the local tourist attractions upon arrival, we found the property so nice here we didn't leave, other than grocery shopping at one of the many stores located within a mile or two, until after the second day. With the close proximity to the Disney parks it made traveling to and from a breeze. Entry to this property is off World Drive so once you turn out you drive straight into the Disney World properties. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. For those that do not climb steps well I recommend the first floor. Our unit is one the top (2nd) floor and although there are several steps it is not a steep incline but could be a problem for one that has difficulty with steps. Units have full kitchen, full sized washer and dryer, living room, dining room, master bedroom with a phenomenal bathroom/shower (the likes I have never experienced in a rental), a very niced sized screened in patio area. The second bedroom has a full sized and a twin bed with an attached bathroom. Although we didn't use it or the pull-out sofa this unit could have slept 7. As a matter of fact we wish we could stay another week, 2 or 3. Our stay could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy, clean, close to WDW”
Reviews.Author: Paradocs22
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here for a week in November in a two bedroom condo with full kitchen, living room, 2 baths (the one off the master bedroom is huge and unusual). There was plenty of space for all of us for less than the cost of a hotel room. Having a kitchen allowed us to eat breakfasts in and to make our lunches, saving money for great dinners out. The unit was clean and daily housekeeping services kept it that way. Originally we were assigned a 2nd floor unit overlooking the pool. It was noisy and less private so the front desk graciously switched to another overlooking the pond and fairways, Sitting on the balcony was then most pleasant. The entry road to Sabal Palms winds around the back of the Marriott World Center Hotel and is unattractive. But once there, the grounds are quite nice. The Sabal pool is somewhat plain, but you get use of all of the pools in the development. We spent a restful day at the huge main pool at the hotel. On exiting the complex you turn right on a main road which leads straight to WDW. It made going back and forth very easy. Given the location, attractive units and excellent value, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Mammo64
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights. 2 bedrooms but only needed one Attending a conference but it was great to have a kitchen. Pool was clean, fitness center had up to date equipment. Villas are updated. Spa at the hotel was very clean and wonderful service, Shuttle service is very quick. Some may find the steps in the villa an issue

Reviews.Title: “Great weather ... for inviting bugs”
Reviews.Author: conmarjohn
Reviews.Content: Our family plus 2 grandchildren, both celebrating 1st birthdays at Disneyworld, stayed here 7 days and had no complaints until we moved the couch to retrieve a child's building block. There it set, a large roach, not alive thank goodness. Two other ones were also seen later in the morning, scurrying from under the sink while I was changng the trash liner. My daughter reported our findings to the Sabal Palms front desk and was told she would have to take it up with the manager, who works at a sister property down the road. It was our check out day, so I mentioned the insect problem when turning in our room cards. The desk clerk's response was "at least they didn't show up until yor last day". She then went on to say the cooler weather {mid 80's}, was driving them inside. I reminded her that we were at a Marriott property and whether it was here or Alaska, room standards must be upheld. We have vacationed here many times since 2003 staying at the same villa each time. We- have never received any less than outstanding service and room quality until this trip. The grounds were well kept and use of the World Center ammenities are always a benefit. Our requests for extra bedding and towels were deliverd promptly with follow up calls to the room. We will continue to stay at Marriott properties for future vacations, just not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, but they are missing a lot...”
Reviews.Author: dks61885
Reviews.Content: The villas at this property are very spacious and have some great amenities. Our villa had two bedrooms. The first room had two beds in it - it was pretty tight walking around the room. It connected to a bathroom that was nicely furnished. The master bedroom was very large and had a great bathroom with double sinks. The shower was huge, but I found ants in it twice.. I called the front desk after each time and they had someone come up to spray. They didn't seem surprised when I called to complain or apologize so I'm assuming they hear this complaint frequently. The kitchen was a nice size and fully stocked with everything that we needed and then some. There was also a dining room, living room, and screened in balcony with a table and chairs.It was very spacious, but everything was worn down. The rugs had slight stains on them, and the TV would work but you could tell that it was in desperate need of an upgrade. What bothered me the most this trip was the staff. While I didn't have many encounters with them, the ones that I did speak to had no customer service skills. I called room service daily to ask them to bring up extra towels and they never did. I also asked the front desk for a taxi service to use for the weekend and one they gave me was over priced and completely rude (don't use Metro Taxi). The Marriott World Center was a short walk away from Sabal Palms so we used their pools, and restaurants frequently. Everything in that building was lovely and it was a good alternative to the property we were staying at. There are also no shuttles to Disney from here which is pretty ridiculous since it is a short distance away from the parks. Next time I will choose a different resort this one just didn't have everything I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: good_page
Reviews.Content: This is by far better units than the old units in Grand Vista. You know what you are getting here, not hoping that you will receive a renovated room. This place is very relaxing. I requested a Villa close to the pool and on the bottom floor, and was granted both requests. The staff is very nice here. The unit looks over the golf course which is very relaxing and we saw the alligator and the girls loved this. There is a full size washer and dryer which is very nice but it is in the kitchen and very loud. The water has an odor while the clothes are washing. I added vinegar to the laundry load and this took care of that. I washed our towels instead of asking for new ones. The vinegar made them very soft. There is no separate bath in mbr if this matters to you. Shower is great! It is walk in , has 2 side sprays and a waterfall spray from above. It was very nice to wash two children at once when they were tired. The steps did worry me but they were not a problem. We would definitely come back here. Did not make full use of the World Centre because we just did not have the time The girls did kids night out and they loved that!. This gave the parents a little down time to just rest. The staff was very very nice. The pool is nice . It is small but it was only us and one other family in it. My daughter was playing with another child and he jumped into the pool and she followed. Be very careful, as the shallow side of the pool has 3 steps all the way accross,so jumping into the pool there is dangerous. Parking was shaded with trees, also a plus. There is a nice walmart close by that has single packaged snacks - apples with grapes and carrots with ranch dressing which makes it nice for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort great facilities”
Reviews.Author: KieranMcDonough
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Sabal Palms at the Marriott World Centre in August and we had a fantastic time. The room is spacious and modern with all the facilities you would expect from a Marriott vacation club resort. The hotel itself would be fine for most hotels, but having the World Centre on your door step makes it much more enjoyable, We used various facilities, particularly the pools and the basketball courts, for my son. If I was being picky then the 2aspects that I would change are: 1/ The check in time is 4.00pm, which I think could be 2.00pm. 2/ The room was only cleaned once a week by maid service. The rooms did not have maid service daily, however whenever we needed the towels, disshcloths, or nay items refreshed they were done in a very short time, and it was never an issue. As I said I am being a bit picky as overall the hotel was superb, with a fantastic location close to Disney, you can see Planet Holywood from the pool area. The World centre pools are 5mins walk and they are fantastic, especially the main pool and the spa pool ( for a relaxing environment). We used the BBQ unit outside the room on several occasions and it made a pleasant change from eating out or cooking inside. Some nice looking restaurants on site, but we did not eat in any of them, but we did eat in the food court, which was very reasonably priced for a 5* hotel. I would highly recommend this resort for a great Orlando experience and throuroughly great fun with all the facilities.Hope you enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet, very spacious”
Reviews.Author: totonka99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in December 2010 using Marriott points. We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit, 2 bath unit on the second floor. Overall the unit was huge. The furniture was a bit dated. Kitchen, however, was fully stocked and updated. Unit also had a washer and dryer. Unit overlooked a golf course and a pond. Great location. Just outside the Disney Entrance. I think we were only 10 minutes from door to Epcot parking lot. Close by is also a Walmart and other off Disney property restaurants. The resort is part of the larger Marriott property, but has it's own check-in desk, pool, workout center. But you still have access to the huge pool area, workout center, restaurants, etc that are part of the Marriott hotel - which is huge. The hotel has restaurants, bar areas, an arcade, etc. It's pretty much setup for large conventions. There are also at least 2 pools, and a huge workout facility. The condo's are a bit of a tedious drive through the Marriott property to get to. A good trade-off for the long drive is that it is very quiet. Master bathroom is huge. The master bathroom, however, doesn't have a tub. It had a strange shower room configuration (I guess some people would like that?). Took us a while to figure out which knobs and dials turned on what in the shower. Second bedroom is smaller with a sliding door to the second bathroom. The facilities that are part of the condo are small and pretty plain. We didn't use any of these as those that were part of the hotel were much better. Only inconvenience we had was accessing the workout center that was part of the larger Marriott hotel. Even though the workout center was just next door to the condo's, the key were given wouldn't work for it. Because the condo check-in building was closed early in the morning, I had to walk a very long way twice early in the morning just to get a key to the workout center. I guess it's a tip to make sure that your keys work when you check-in at the condo's check-in building. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MCJ70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 1 week last week of Aug.2011. Its very good, clean hotel and helpfull staff. The hotel is very closed to all the ammenities and attraction. Specially to Walt Disney. Our kids loved it! very secluded it feels like you are in the residential area with all the ammenities in one roof. 5 mins drive to Wallmart so you can buy all your foods&groceries and most of all the Outlets...shop till you drop!!!! Everybody had fun , for sure we will be back in this hotel, we loved it...

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place for our Disney World vacation!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie804
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights here when we took our 2 sons to Disney World. It was a wonderful place to use as our home base for our days in the parks. The location is outstanding. It is about 1-2 miles from the entrance to the Disney parks. There are restaurants, grocery stores as well as every other kind of store you can imagine very conveniently to this area. This resort is nestled behind the Marriott World Center so you have access to the wonderful pools and amenities there as well as the Sabal Palms pool and recreation area. It is a quiet area although there may be some units that are quieter than others based on which unit you are assigned. We had a unit toward the back which backed up to a pond and golf course. There was some slight I-4 road noise when we sat on our screened porch area, but it wasn't an issue for us. The unit is beautifully appointed and comfortable. It was immaculantly clean and modern. The updated kitchen was fully stocked with the wares one needs for a week. It was nice to have those kitchen conveniences as well as the washer and dryer. The beds were comfortable and we enjoyed the layout of the unit. Our only slight disappointment was the inability to get the master bedroom very dark at night. The shower has a wall of glass block which allows the porch lights to shine right in the room. I like a very dark room so that was not ideal for us but we were fine nonetheless. Also, we were on an upper level room (there are only 2 floors) and in our unit, there are 2 steps from the foyer to the living area as well as 2 steps from the master bath to the master bedroom. It worked just fine for us because we are young but that may be an issue if you have a hard time with steps or have an elderly person that does. Just FYI... Overall, we LOVED this location and highly recommend it for families that are traveling to the Orlando area. All of the employees that we dealt with at Marriott were helpful and accomodating. They called our unit to make sure everything was okay and to our liking. We would always try to return here when we vacation in Orlando again!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our timeshare week here”
Reviews.Author: disneyrocksFlorida
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice, furniture not to comfortable, kinda old and used. We loved the lay out of the 2 bedroom unit, but has 2 stairs going up to 2nd bedroom. Our unit overlooked the pool and we loved the convience, we swam every evening after the Disney parks. We had to take a shuttle to do things over at the other Marriott properties to do kid crafts and swim at the Marriott World center. Pricey food that was o.k onsite. Overall, nice clean relaxing week. We would use our timeshare week here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great suite hotel for a family at Disney area”
Reviews.Author: Loslapillos
Reviews.Content: We had a great vacation at Sabal Palms. We had a two bedroom suite with full kitchen and living room. Two bathrooms were needed for a family of four people. Two teenagers enjoyed the space we had. We were surprised how large the Marriot hotel area is. At Sabal Palms there is a small and quiet pool, but within three minute walk there is a huge pool at Marriot hotel. Our kids prefered the small and quiet pool. We wanted to rest between park days at pool. The other surprise were an alligator and a turtle behind our hotel in the river. There it was: an alligator taking sun on the golf course on the other side of river and we could see it from our balcony and take pictures. We enjoyed the space at our rooms and the best part was the cleaning every day. We ate our breakfast and went to the pool or park. When we got back, we had new towels, beds were made, living room and kitchen were in perfect condition. We had an easy and relaxing week stay at Sabal Palms.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and out of the hustle bustle”
Reviews.Author: ABoomer48
Reviews.Content: Spent a week with our son, his wife and 2 kids here. This is a great place for families. Older but updated with nice rooms and screened-in porches. Convenient to all Disney parks. Four pools on the grounds for visitors to use.

Reviews.Title: “We keep going back!”
Reviews.Author: YullieYullie
Reviews.Content: Sabal Palms at the Marriott World Center is a prime example of timeshare perfection! Big comfortable, two bedrooms, two bathrooms, with every amenity whirlpool tub large walk in glass block shower that is huge, etc., fully equipped gorgeous kitchens, screened in porch on beautiful golf course! Pools are all excellent and never overcrowded. We have been there at least 4 times and have never been disappointed. Staff is warm and very helpful at all times. We have also stayed in the Royal Palms on the same property and it's equally as nice but only one bedroom, one bath units.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed our expectations for a truly great escape!”
Reviews.Author: sharongail
Reviews.Content: We came to Orlando for a reasonably priced escape from winter. We didn't have overly high expectations because we've been to Orlando before and we would have preferred to go somewhere more exotic. Instead, we were wowed by this beautiful resort in every way from the peaceful, spotless, and beautiful two bedroom villa, to the services and amenities of the main resort, the Marriott World Center. We enjoyed looking out our panoramic window at the wildlife in the ponds, and watching the golfers just beyond. It was relaxing in the villa, while all the action was just a two minute stroll over to the main hotel. Everyone was extremely helpful, and all housekeeping/maintenance requests were responded to almost immediately. We especially enjoyed the "Spa Pool" and the large outdoor hot tub at the main resort, even though the Sabal Palms does have its own pool and hot tubs. The grounds are especially pretty and exotic. We ate at Hawk's Landing on site, and the steaks were just delicious. Parking is free at Sabal Palms and this is very convenient. Some buildings have better views and less noise from the road across the golf course. We were in building 44 and we were fine, although building 42 might just be the optimal, completely away from the road noise. As I got this through the "getaways" program through Interval International, it was a total surprise on the upside for the reasonable price that I paid. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Tucked Away”
Reviews.Author: Igo57
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my sister in the 2 bedroom villa. Nicely appointed villa tucked in the back of the Marriott World Center Resort. If your looking for a nice and quiet area this would be the place to stay. Minor issues: the second bedroom has a full size and a twin size bed, the twin bed was very close to the closet which made it quite awkward. Also, if you have a hard time with stairs I would request a first floor villa, since there are no elevators to the 2nd floor. Other than that this is a great place to stay while in Orlando. Did visit the spa which is a 2 minute walk from the villas, the services were very good. Did not venture up the the Resort, but there is a shuttle that will bring you there. Several resturants up and down the Highway - The outlets are very close too - Right down Vineland Road.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice villa”
Reviews.Author: mcmmhh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our one year old son and my parents. We had a 2 bedroom villa which didn't look like much from the outside but was surprisingly nice inside. The floor plan was perfect for privacy, and the unit was quite spacious. One bedroom had 2 queen beds with an attached bathroom with a bathtub. The master suite had a king bed and private bath with a huge shower. The room was advertised to have a jacuzzi tub, but there was not one in either bathroom. The screened in lanai overlooked a pretty courtyard area and was perfect for eating breakfast outdoors. The kitchenette had updated appliances and was quite nice. The location was great as well. We had spent the weekend at Disney and the drive to the parks was short. This hotel would also be convenient to Universal Studios and Sea World. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious suites a good value”
Reviews.Author: Plantravel
Reviews.Content: Positives: Suites are clean and spacious Sabal Palms is the closest vacation property to the main hotel (6min walk) Flat screen TV's in both bedrooms, plus the living room A better value than the main hotel (especially if you book early) Improvement areas: Shuttle not reliable (sometimes never came, and other times only after a 35 minute wait) - resulted in my overall service rating of 3 out of 5 Drip coffee provided, but many suites seemed to be missing creamer and sugar packets

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Sabal Palms”
Reviews.Author: FasoldFamily
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to Sabal Plams with two young children (a 2 1/2 year old and a 6 month old) and we thought Sabal Plams was really great. The 2 bedroom layout was great, newly renovated, flat screen TVs in the living room and bedrooms, and a great kitchen. We were able to eat breakfast everyday in our room and also dinner a few nights. There are two nice communal stainless steel grills available which I used. There is a great smaller pool in Sabal Plams and it is a 2 minute walk to the huge pool at the World Center. All of the attractions are close by, Disney is right down the road. The World Center also has many great restaurants including a great sports bar. Overall, we had a great vacation staying at Sable Palms and would definitely recommend it for families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet comfort.”
Reviews.Author: mdFoxes
Reviews.Content: Unlike some other reviewers, we liked the sunken living room. The higher ceilings gave a real roomy feel in the main living area. The master bedroom was spacious and my husband wanted to take the shower home with us. The only down side was the 2nd bedroom. It had a twin and a double (or queen) bed and had mere inches between them and the walls. A large adult or teen wouldn't be able to get into the closet. But since it had 2 beds and a flat screen TV, the kids didn't complain. Being beside the World Center made this resort hard to beat. Their pool hits the spot after a day in the sun. The grounds were very beautiful and well tended. And being able to park near our villa was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “need a car”
Reviews.Author: Cheshirelass
Reviews.Content: Stayed for last week in Sept and first in Oct. Villa was comfortable and spacious apart from second bedroom which was cramped with 2 beds in it. Buying supplies caused problems as we are not drivers in the U.S. and had to get a taxi everywhere. The place is rather isolated even though close to Epcot. It is really necessary to drive if you don't want to spend a fortune on taxis.Found good taxi people Adamz and Ato Z. Restraunts expensive only ate there twice. Shuttle to the pther Marriott villas and hotel was very useful but don't use there market shop. Useless if you need to stock up on even the basics.

Reviews.Title: “Better here than the hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcx
Reviews.Content: This is the closest of the three Marriott Vacation Club properties on the Marriott World Center grounds. It is directly behind the hotel. Sabal Palms has two bedroom condos. They are good sized, decently clean and well equiped. Flat screen sattelite TV's in both bedrooms and the living room, free wireless internet, washer and dryer, full kitchen, etc. Second bedroom has two beds, plus there is a pull out sofa. Staying here gives you free access to the numerous Marriott hotel faclities, including the pools, which are good for both adults and children. The pools are a short walk. It's very quiet back in the condo area, unlike the hotel, which can be crowded and noisy. What makes this even better is that staying here is often cheaper than the hotel. For example, they had a stay three days, get two free with purchase of two adult, three day Disney passes. Parking and internet cost extra at the hotel, but are free at the condos. The condo itself worked out to $120 per night. The World Center property sits right outside the Disney gate, so it is feasible to come back for an hour or two to eat and rest before returning to Disney. There was no time share sales pitch while we were here. You should consider this property when visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “I would pack my bags and fly back today!”
Reviews.Author: foursabunch
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for my family, we loved it! Myself, my Husband and our 2 sons ages 5 and 8 stayed for 7 nights. We go away alot, we love to travel, and we love it here. This villa was about 2 miles out of Disney, our 2 bedroom villa was spotless nothing to complain about. The main hotel had a masssssive pool and about 5 other ones including the spa pool, that I loved. The villas also had a great pool that was also spotless, they also had jumbo checkers and chess that we all loved. The golf course look great, but we were not here top play golf..I had to keep reminding my hubby. The breakfast at the Marriott World was nice the buffet was endless, the sports bar was also good. But...the food court in the lower level was a little much for me (too many people sloping all over the place) The pool side bar-cafe looked liked a better choice. There was a shuttle bus to take you round trip back to the villas. Would we go back..Yes! My kids ask us all the time.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: jbhooch
Reviews.Content: stayed for approx 15 days. Ideal location for visit to disney & surrounding theme parks. walmart nearby for groceries so hardly used the restaurants in the main hotel.hired a hertz car from the marriott hotel so commuting was no problem. good & spacious rooms .wifi free but very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in the heart of Disney...”
Reviews.Author: MickeyFan71
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome. My family and I visited the week of June 26th - July 3rd. This was our 4th trip to the Disney area. For our first and second trips we rented a private home. Last year, for our third trip we stayed at the Springhill Suites @ Lake Buena Vista which was also nice - but much smaller. Marriott's Sabal Palms provided our best accommodations yet. Our room (4123) had been recently renovated and was absolutely beautiful. The pictures on Marriott's website do not do this property justice. It was well appointed, very clean, spacious and in extremely close proximity to the Disney parks. Everything you needed was provided for - the kitchen had all new appliances and was stocked with utensils, pots/pans, cups/mugs, dishes, paper towels, dish soap, automatic dish soap, (new) sponge and laundry soap (there is a full size washer and dryer), etc... The bathrooms were stocked with the basics - shampoo and plenty of towels. The master bedroom was huge with a king size bed, walk in shower and attached screened porch (also attached to the living room). The second bedroom had one full size bed, one twin and an attached full bathroom. This was perfect for our family of 5. We received daily maid service - each night when we came back from the park our room was sparkling clean with fresh linens and nicely made bed. All the staff we encountered were very pleasant. You also have access to all the amenities @ Marriott's World Center, but between our time spent at the parks as well as the amenities we had right on the property @ Sabal Palms, we never made it up there. Sabal Palms has a nice (and not crowded) pool, a game room, fitness center, tennis courts, basket ball courts and sand volleyball. Equipment (for a small fee) and board games are available for rent @ the check-in desk. We did receive one call do to a timeshare tour, but they did not pester us when we indicated we would not be interested. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Accommodation in great location”
Reviews.Author: EmilyBNorthWales
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Marriotts Sabal Palms and had a wonderful time. Apartment was spacious and had everything you needed. Fabulous walk in shower, lovely and clean, plenty of towels and toiletries. Fantastic views of golf course and turtles in the river below our balcony. Staff were brilliant and nothing was too much trouble. Brilliant location for visiting Disney and other orlando attractions. 4 minute drive to Downtown Disney, supermarkets 5 mins, seaworld 7 mins. Would definately recommend this hotel. You had use of the facilities for Marriott World Centre and Royal and imperial palms. Felt very safe and secure whilst on the property. Just about to book next years holiday there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice condo unit, spacious, and close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: redelaneymd
Reviews.Content: We traded for this unit through Interval International, and were well pleased. The unit was very clean, and well appointed. The second BR did have one double and one twin bed (not two doubles), which created a bit of strife amongst the kids. This is a part of the large Mariott tower and conference center near Disney. The Sabal Palms unit was rather "hidden" and a little difficult to navigate at night for the first time. However, travel to the parks each day was quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our first Disney trip!”
Reviews.Author: kdets89
Reviews.Content: I finally got my husband to agree to a trip to Disney World for our family of 5. We had a wonderful trip and the Villas were a perfect place to "go home" to at the end of an exhausting day at the parks. Parking was literally steps from our door. Kitchen was fully equiped (only thing we really missed was a pizza cutter). Everything was clean and updated, and the master shower was wonderful! Lots of space in the living area to spread out and relax. The screened porch was fantastic. My kids loved the pool and the life size chess set. The resort was as convenient to any Disney park as the resorts, though we did have to drive ourselves and pay for parking. We didn't mind that since we had such a great price for the villa and could come and go as we pleased without any wait or hassle. We also enjoyed the slower pace and lack of crowds at the resort as compared to the Disney resorts we saw during our trip. We are actually contemplating a return trip in a few years and this will be where we stay, without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but the bathrooms needed updating.”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelfivestar
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week and the location is great. I was told the villa was recently updated but the bathrooms were awful. The AC was also not great and we could not get our bedroom cool. The staff were friendly and I told them right away we did NOT want a timeshare. They called twice but did not bug us. The pool was OK but is had no bar service. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a gem waiting just out of Disny's reach”
Reviews.Author: wildturkey52
Reviews.Content: Just about 8 minutes from any Disney Park. 10 minutes from Sea World or Universal Studios. This resort is situated a bit close to I-4 so try to stay poolside or courtside. Easy access to all of Orlando and an hour to the Space Coast. West coast a bit further but this makes a great base to radiate out from.

Reviews.Title: “Staying on Points - Value is Great”
Reviews.Author: jmpjoy
Reviews.Content: USed 150K Marriott points to stay in a 2 bedroom unit. Everything was great except the tvs needed to be upgraded and you need conditioners in the room (only shampoo). The pool in the timeshare is nice enough and great for young kids - goes from 3 feet to 5 feet. We never ventured to main pool as we had a young child. Also a dvd player in all rooms would be beneficial. The location is great. Literally 10 minutes from Epcot, 12 from Holiday Studios 15 Magic Kingdom - 2 miles from main entrance of disney world. Walmart and Publix are both within close proximity. Also the chelsea premium outlets are within 7 minutes - the only authorized disney outlet center. Overall, I would stay here in a heartbeat provided we could use our points or get a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ItalyTravel2006
Reviews.Content: This year we traded our timeshare and stayed at Sabal Palms. It was a relaxing and enjoyable week. Sabal Palms is close to the main Marriott waterfall pool that our boys love! It is also close (walking distance) to the golf course. Overall we enjoyed our week. If there was a down side it's that the 2nd bedroom has a full and a twin size bed. We are used to our home resort that has 2 queen size beds in the 2nd bedroom. For our tall boys it was a little uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Sabal Palms is just OK.”
Reviews.Author: Sas6090
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at this Marriott. I've stayed at the Marriott's Grand Vista many times, and it is so much better than the Sabal Palms. The good points, I had a newer room, The shower in the master bedroom is fantastic, and the Marriott World Center is close by. The bad points, the villa has a large step down from the kitchen to the living room, and from the bathroom in the master bedroom. This is not good for small children, or the handicap. The pool is very small. The main lobby closes at 9pm, so if you need anything you must drive to the Royal Palms. My husband had to go to the Royal Palms to get new keys at 11:30 pm, when all 4 of our keys would not open the door. They don't come to you. In closing, the only reason I might stay there again is because of the Marriott World Center. It cost less to stay at the Sabal Palms, and you can use the facilities of the Marriott World Center.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing stay!”
Reviews.Author: cbee201
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 recently stayed in a 2 bedroom condo at Sabal Palms and we couldn't have asked for more. The condo is spacious and well laid out. The kitchen and bathrooms are upgraded (the master bath has an awesome shower with a rain showerhead and wall jets) and the living room/dining room gave us plenty of room to spread out. We also enjoyed having a screened in balcony overlooking the pool and golf course. We did not experience the housekeeping problems of other posters - the daily cleaning service was reliable and thorough. The Sabal Palms pool was just steps away and we usually had it to ourselves. The kids loved it! The gym is small but adequate. My only complaint is that the front desk closes early- 5 pm during the week and 9 pm on the weekends - if you arrive after that time, you need to go to the Imperial Palms desk (a 2 minute drive away) and it would have been nice to know that in advance since we arrived at midnight when our tempers were short. Other than that, our stay was perfect. The resort is a short and easy drive to Disney and SeaWorld. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Service was better than "legendary" Disney”
Reviews.Author: KazooKrew
Reviews.Content: I've worked in restaurants for twenty years and there's an old saying that great service can make up for a poor meal but a great meal wont make up for poor service. Ami Thomas at Marriott's Sabal Palms proved to me that it's also true in the hotel industry. We booked a room several months ahead and specifically got a whirlpool tub in our room as both my wife and myself have back problems. When we arrived guess what we found, no whirlpool! We asked a passing staff member to contact a manager for us and Ami came to our room within minutes. She explained that the tubs had been removed during a renovation, apologized that we had not been contacted and informed since the tubs had been removed between the time of our reservation and our checkin, and had hotel staff come and move all our stuff to a room that still had a whirlpool (and was larger) whithout us having to lift a finger! By the way, when the same thing happened at the Bellagio in Las Vegas during our wedding the staff there looked me straight in the eye and said such rooms never existed, an email arrived at our home a week after our trip explaining that rooms were being changed and that amenities would be different. Anyway, Ami Thomas was the Princess of Service on our Disney vacation. Also a great location, turn right out of the hotel and you are in disney in two minutes without even a turn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: Dezmond
Reviews.Content: Three generations stayed in a villa for spring break, and had a great time. Usually with 2 little kids we start to feel closed in, even in an extended stay hotel, but the villas at Sabal Palms are huge. The large screened porch is a nice plus. Our unit seemed to be updated with the exception of the guest bathroom. Being able to walk to the main Marriott was great; so much for everyone to do there. We never left the compound due to having so many pools (even indoor for one rainy day), kids play center, and great walking paths. We will for sure stay here again, and I highly recommend for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort - everything we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: wiigs
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Sabal Palms. The resort had everything we were looking for. Our room had a recently renovated bath & kitchen and everything was very clean. The room was very spacious - we had plenty of room to spread out. We were within walking distance to the World Center pool and had a playground right outside our front door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful property”
Reviews.Author: DRNH
Reviews.Content: We cashed in our Marriott Rewards points and stayed at the Sabal Palms resort with our kids. The place was great. It was less than 10 minutes to all the Disney parks which made it easy to go back to the room for mid-day naps. The Marriott World Center was next door and there were at least 4 swimming pools on the property. There was never anyone in the Sabal Palms pools. The rooms were very spacious and relaxing. They haven't been remodeled in awhile but it appears they are doing a lot of work rehabing the other units, although we never heard any construction noise. I would definately go back to Sabal Palms.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated”
Reviews.Author: family_man_075
Reviews.Content: I was very distressed reading the previous reviews on this place. However, here are the facts. Most people go to orlando to see the theme parks, and need a comfortable place to stay. This resort is just what my family needed. HUGE 2 bedroom villa, with all in-suite ammenities. Very quiet, and relatively close to the parks. There is an onsite shuttle to the market at imperial palms clubhouse, and it will take you to the marriott world center where there is fitness facilities, pools, and restaurants. This is our 3rd timeshare stay in marriott properties, and what we think is that so far Ko Olina is the nicest (and newest), but Sabal palms is the Largest. There is a small pool just outside the villa door. The villas over look the golf course and each has a screened patio to sit on. What I was told at check in, is that they are only renting the renovated villas at this time, so there is no risk of getting an "old" unit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall Stay”
Reviews.Author: Eastby
Reviews.Content: Marriott Sabal Palms is the oldest timeshare facility in the Marriott Vacation Club. We went during Spring Break on an exchange week (through Interval International) in a swap for one of the bedrooms of our Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club villa on Kapolei, Oahu, Hawaii. After having stayed at the Ko Olina, virtually any other Marriott timeshare would be somewhat of a letdown, and this was certainly no exception. Overall, it was OK. Comfortable, serviceable, and quiet (pretty empty actually), but just OK overall. We would probably not stay at the Sabal Palms again. It was rather small for a 2-bedroom villa, and the age really showed. Mirror tiles on the living room wall...old furnishings...applicances in poor condition...plastic table surface on outside deck drooping so much (from the heat) that it looked like the top of a mushroom. Marriott is not investing any money into this resort to replace old fixtures; they just keep trying to repair them. Our dishwasher leaked, we called it in, the repair man came and knocked around on it for about 5 minutes (while it was running) and left. The next day it began leaking again in the exact same spot. The dishwasher door didn't close properly...and still doesn't. The clothes dryer took forever to dry the clothes (probably plugged ducting or no venting), and several light bulbs were out and in need of replacing. The Sabal Palms is virtually hidden in the shadow of the nearby Marriott Florida World Center Hotel, but access to the hotel is very close as a result, and the big pool there was extremely enjoyable (even though two poolside drinks cost $24!). The villa decks are quite comfortable, with fine mesh screens covering them to keep the bugs out (very good idea). Close access to Disney World theme parks, but the Florida road system (and signage) in and around Disney is the most confusing I have ever navigated in a car. Overall, "OK to Pretty Good" stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: docajenk
Reviews.Content: Excellent in all respects. We had a 2 bed villa on the upper floor looking over the golf course. The villa was very homely, well equipped and very spacious. You are able to use all the facilities of the main hotel, which is only a short walk (they even run a free shuttle bus for those less able to walk) and has numerous swimming pools, health club, restaurants and shops. If you are wanting to eat out there are numerous restaurants within 10mins drive which were all excellent. The location is perfect with only a short drive to the parks and retail outlets. Staff all very friendly and helpful. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our 3rd stay at Sabal Palms”
Reviews.Author: Beeloo03
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that we've toured other timeshare properties and are aware that there are others that are more new, updated, and many have a few more ammenities available. But we always end up returning to Sabal Palms because we like the privacy and set-up of the villas. Unlike other properties where the buildings are almost apartment like (several stories high, with outside hallways running the length of the buildings to access your room doors.......and consisting of LOTS OF NOISE), the Sabal Palms villas are two stories high and you have only one private entryway to your villa. We have always liked that feature. You have a beautiful pool and two hot tubs right there at the villas (and it's often near-empty.....we sometimes had it to ourselves!). You also have the huge pool to go to over at the World Center (walking distance from Sabal) and a REALLY gorgeous pool which sits right behind the huge World Center Pool (this is our favorite pool........it is just lovely, with palm trees in the middle, and a gigantic hot tub). After staying here 3 times, the negatives aren't many, but I do have to mention them. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE do yourselves a favor and be sure to get an upstairs villa, if all possible!! This year, we were in a downstairs one, and the noise level from the upstairs neighbors was just unbearable. They had a small child who ran, jumped, pounded, banged on the floors, furniture.........it drove us to near insanity!! LOL We've stayed in the upstairs units before, and it's nothing but peace and quiet. The screened-in porch is quite lovely, but at times, you'll notice small rips or holes in the screens (nothing major).......those things should be repaired in a timely manner (last year we called about a rip in a screen, and the maintenance crew never came to repair it, so we were disappointed in that). As I've stated, there ARE more modern and fancy timeshare places in the Orlando area, but you can't beat Sable Palms for privacy and the beautiful swimming pools that you have access to. We'll definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: born2travel97
Reviews.Content: My wife,three children, a couple of their friends and I stayed here for 9 days after a very long drive from jersey. When we originally booked the hotel online the pictures looked a little out dated but once we arrived and opened the door the place was very clean and spacious. We had a 2nd story condo with sliding doors in the living room and master bedroom that led to the screened balcony overlooking a beautiful golf course. The master bed room was huge and had its own shower and jacuzzi with everything working. The Kitchen was spacious and well equipped. This unit had a decent sized pool just outside but we enjoyed the much bigger pool just outside the main marriot tower .There is a Starbucks and a couple of restauraunts here also. We didn't eat there, their menus looked pricey. No sweat though there are plenty of other places to choose from nearby. Very close to Disney and outlet shopping areas.(less than 2 miles) We really enjoyed it. Our stay was very comfortable and yes we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful house keeping.”
Reviews.Author: Unsatisfied_46
Reviews.Content: We stayed there one week, Dec 17~24. First night the stopper of the whirlpool was missing. A provissional one was found by security. Next morning we found out that the bed spread was stained with blood. House keeping lady was really nasty. We complained, just a call was made when we were out of our room. No follow up intended. We did not get any apologies. We asked for extra blankets and a torn to shreads blanket was given to us. A real sorry blanket even for a one star room. Complained and no excuses or apologies. We expected to find at least a letter in our mail.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: janetf
Reviews.Content: Sabal Palms is just a part of the Marriott Orlando World Center Resort and Convention, which is a massive resort. The main building is huge, and has Florida's largest pool. The grounds are gorgeous. There are several satellite properties on the grounds, and Sabal Palms is located in the back - not too far of a walk over to the main building. I was a little skeptical after some of the reviews, but our 2 bedroom- 2 bath villa was very nice. It was not new, but kept in good condition, and very clean. The staff is very nice. Very close to Disney, although this was just a trip for relaxing and not sight seeing for us. Sabal Palm's pool was never crowded, probably because most guests are at Disney during the day. It was like we had our own private pool. Our screened-in porch was spacious, and nice to sit on in the evening. The main Marriott Resort is something to see - food court and shops, beautiful lobby. Very impressive property overall with lovely scenery. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “going back”
Reviews.Author: moo224
Reviews.Content: We like it a lot.It is very close to disney. The rooms are in need of a up date.But it was ok.I have stayed in better places in that area.The pool at the main hotel my kids loved.The free wireless internet was great.We are going back again this fall.Back when the resort was built it was state of the art in the late 70s t o early 80s.

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott's Sabal Palms
HotelInfo.Address: 8805 World Center Drive, Orlando, FL 32821
